title: Soldiers Posing in Front of the Enola Gay Airplane on Tinian Island
Scopenote: Written on back: "Casey, Bloom, Sweeney, Meismer, Dailey. B-29 that dropped first Atomic Bomb over Hiroshima Aug. 6th 1945. This taken in Sept. of 1945." Fourth the left is Irwin R. "Bob" Meismer. Five American soldiers posing in front of the Enola Gay airplane on the island of Tinian. This photo is part of the Irwin R. "Bob" Meismer Photographs Library Collection.

title: An American Soldier Standing Beside The Great Artiste
Scopenote: Written on back: "509th B. Grp. plane on Both Nagasaki & Hiroshima A Bomb Runs." Unidentified soldier standing in front of the Great Artiste airplane on the island of Tinian. This photo is part of the Irwin R. "Bob" Meismer Photographs Library Collection.

title: Lucky Strike Bomber
Scopenote: Lucky Strike, a bomber airplane used in World War II, sitting on an airfield on the island of Tinian. This photo is part of the Irwin R. "Bob" Meismer Photographs Library Collection.

title: Planes Sitting on the Airfield at Tinian Island
Scopenote: Written on back: "North Field Tinian." Airplanes sit on the airfield at Tinian Island in the Pacific during World War II. This photo is part of the Irwin R. "Bob" Meismer Photographs Library Collection.

title: Army Air Force Base on Tinian Island
Scopenote: Written on back: "Tinian Island 1945." View of the United States Army Air Force Base on Tinian Island during World War II. This photo is part of the Irwin R. "Bob" Meismer Photographs Library Collection.

title: North Field of Air Base at Tinian Island
Scopenote: Written on back: "View of Airfield. North Field. Tinian Island 1945. 99th Bomb Squadron V.H., 9th Bomb Group, 20th Air Force." Wide view of the airfield, with several planes and huts visible. This photo is part of the Irwin R. "Bob" Meismer Photographs Library Collection.

title: Aerial view of Tinian Island
Scopenote: Written on back: "Tinian Island." Aerial view of Tinian Island, an Army Air Force Base, during World War II. This photo is part of the Irwin R. "Bob" Meismer Photographs Library Collection.

title: American Cemetery on Tinian Island
Scopenote: Written on back: "Cemetery on Tinian Island 1945." An unidentified soldier, left, bows his head in the cemetery. This photo is part of the Irwin R. "Bob" Meismer Photographs Library Collection.

title: Old Historic Ruins on Tinian Island
Scopenote: Written on back: "Old Historic Ruins on Tinian Island." Monument on the Island of Tinian that has Japanese writing and English: "Prehistoric ruins left by unknown race which inhabited Tinian many centuries ago probably formed first floor of temple or house for chieftain." This photo is part of the Irwin R. "Bob" Meismer Photographs Library Collection.

title: Camp Churro on Tinian Island
Scopenote: Written on back: "Camp Churro. Tinian. Native encampment. Dwellings with a few people working at daily tasks." This photo is part of the Irwin R. "Bob" Meismer Photographs Library Collection.

title: President Truman and Prime Minister Churchill at Anglo-American Meeting
Scopenote: Meeting between American and British government officials in Washington, D.C. Seated (L to R): Sir Anthony Eden, British Foreign Minister; Sir Winston Churchill, British Prime Minister; President Harry S. Truman; Dean Acheson, U.S. Secretary of State; John W. Snyder, U.S. Secretary of Treasury; Robert A. Lovett, U.S. Secretary of Defense. Standing (L to R): Walter S. Gifford, U.S. Ambassador to Great Britain; General Omar N. Bradley; Sir Oliver Franks, British Ambassador to the U.S.; Lord Frederick Cherwell; Lord Hastings L. Ismay; W. Averell Harriman. They met aboard the presidential yacht, the USS Williamsburg, where President Truman hosted a dinner in their honor. A large book is open on the table in front of President Truman.

title: President Truman Visits Guantanamo Bay, Cuba
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman salutes unidentified servicemen on the runway of the U.S. Naval base before departing Guantanamo Bay, Cuba. On the same trip, Truman visited Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, and Key West, FL. Truman arrived to Guantanamo Bay by boat in the morning and left for Key West, FL, that afternoon via U.S. Army airplane. Donor: Tim Adelman.

title: Vice President Truman and Jack Benny at the National Press Club
Scopenote: Vice President Harry S. Truman plays the piano, accompanied by Jack Benny on the violin, for four unidentified members of the press at the National Press Club as part of the 1945 Inaugural celebrations. From: Howard Acton.

title: Prime Minister Attlee, President Harry Truman, and General Secretary Stalin at the Potsdam Conference
Scopenote: Photograph of (L to R): Great Britain Prime Minster Clement R. Attlee, United States President Harry S. Truman, and the General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union Joseph Stalin, seated in the garden at the Potsdam Conference. This photograph was taken on July 26, 1945 and was the first ever color news photograph to be transmitted and received by radio waves and published. The photograph was taken by the US Army Signal Corps and transmitted by Master Sergeant Joseph E. Dunn from Potsdam, Germany, to Arlington, Virginia in the United States, where it was received by Technical Sergeant Arthur Grant Anderson. It was transmitted using a transceiver from ACME Newspictures Telephoto Co.

title: Japanese Shrine on Tinian Island
Scopenote: Written on back: "Japanese Shrine Tinian 1945." A Japanese Shrine on the island of Tinian during World War II. This photo is part of the Irwin R. "Bob" Meismer Photographs Library Collection.

title: President Truman meets with the Archbishop of Boston
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with with Archbishop of Boston Richard Cushing, at his residence on Commonwealth Ave. in Brighton, MA.

title: President Truman Laughs from the Rear Platform of a Train
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman shares a laugh with others on the rear platform of a train on an unknown occasion. Left to right: Unidentified man, Jacob M. Arvey, unidentified man, President Truman, and Mayor of Chicago Edward Kelly.

title: President Truman Meets with Members of the Press on Key West Pier
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) and his party meets with unidentified members of the press for a press conference on Pier B at the Naval Station at Key West, FL after returning from Fort Jefferson on Garden Key. Standing to the right of the President is Admiral William Leahy. The president had just disembarked the U.S.S. Sarsfield.

title: Leah Pucci Presents President Truman a Bouquet
Scopenote: L to R:  California State Senator Oliver Carter, President Harry S. Truman, and six-year-old Leah Pucci who is presenting Mr. Truman with a bouquet of flowers on behalf of the Democratic Women of Merced County, California. Mr. Truman was traveling by train during the 1948 campaign. Back of the photo indicates that Oliver Carter later became a California Supreme Court Judge.

title: Former President Truman with Daughter Margaret on her Wedding Day
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman stands in front of the Truman Home with his daughter, Margaret Truman, on her wedding day. Bystanders are unidentified. Photo was taken and donated by John R. Banks.

title: Portrait of Michael A. Pruchnicki
Scopenote: Colorized portrait of United States Army Private Michael A. Pruchnicki.

title: Former Truman Attends a Dinner at Country Club Plaza in Kansas City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (seated) shakes hands with unidentified man at the Clinton P.  Anderson Dinner at Barnard's on Kansas City's Country Club Plaza. Sent to President Truman from E.M. Barnard.

title: Former President Truman talks to S.S. Constitution Cameraman
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) with unidentified cameraman (right), possibly the ship's photographer, aboard the S.S. Constitution returning from his European vacation. Donor: John Brennan from the estate of Leo Coffey.

title: Former President Truman at the American Legion National Convention
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left, wearing his American Legion Missouri hat) and other unidentified members of the Legion at the American Legion National Conference in Chicago, 1958, where he delivered a speech on September 3. Donated by Joseph Beninsto.

title: Former President Truman Speaks at Truman Library Groundbreaking
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman stands at the lectern as he speaks during the Harry S. Truman Library groundbreaking ceremony at Slover Park in Independence, Missouri.

title: Former President Truman Breaking Ground at the Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: (L to R) Basil O'Connor, Former President Harry S. Truman (holding shovel), Tom Evans, and Paul Butler break ground at Slover Park in Independence, MO, for the building of the Harry S. Truman Presidential Library.

title: Former President Truman Visiting William Jewel College
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center) is pictured with William Jewell College President Walter Pope Binns (left), and Charles F. Curry (right) during Truman's visit to William Jewell College in Liberty, Missouri.

title: President Truman and Vice President Barkley at 1949 Presidential Inauguration
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben W. Barkley in the viewing stand, laughing at a passing float during the Inaugural Parade. First Lady Bess Truman and Margaret Truman are seen in the front row, left. Others are unidentified.

title: Former President Truman at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago
Scopenote: The back of former president Harry S. Truman's head at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, IL. Taken by Dr. Richard A. Brickley and sent by Lisa Brickley.

title: Former President Truman and Michigan Senator Patrick V. McNamara
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (holding hat, seated left in car) sits next to Michigan Senator Patrick V. McNamara in a convertible Cadillac. Others unidentified. They are parked adjacent to the Soo Locks at Sault Ste. Marie, Michigan. Sent to Mr. Truman by Harold D. Beaton.

title: Dedication Ceremonies for the Harry S. Truman Statue in Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Dedication ceremonies for the Harry S. Truman statue outside the Jackson County Truman Courthouse in Independence, Missouri. President Gerald Ford is shown near the lectern, and the statue is yet to be unveiled. Donated by George Viegelmann. Scanned from original negative.

title: Dedication Ceremonies for the Harry S. Truman Statue in Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Slightly blurry image from the dedication ceremonies for the Harry S. Truman statue near Jackson County Truman Courthouse in Independence, Missouri. President Gerald Ford is obscured but speaking from a lectern with the unveiled statue behind him. Donated by George Viegelmann. Scanned from original negative.

title: Statue of Harry S. Truman After its Unveiling at the Jackson County Truman Courthouse
Scopenote: Slightly blurry image from after the dedication ceremonies for the Harry S. Truman statue in Independence, Missouri. The unveiled statue stands alone in front of the Jackson County Truman Courthouse in Independence Square. Donated by George Viegelmann. Scanned from original negative.

title: President Gerald Ford's Motorcade Approaching Delaware Street in Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: President Gerald Ford's motorcade leaves the Harry S. Truman Library, approaching Delaware Street from Bess Truman Parkway at the edge of McCoy Park, Independence, Missouri. Donated by George Viegelmann. Scanned from original negative.

title: Bystanders Wave as President Gerald Ford's Limousine Passes Through Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Bystanders wave as President Gerald Ford's limousine passes by on Delaware Street from Bess Truman Parkway at the edge of McCoy Park, Independence, Missouri. President Ford was leaving the Harry S. Truman Library after having dedicated the Truman statue in Independence Square. Donated by George Viegelmann. Scanned from original negative.

title: Statue of Harry S. Truman in Independence, Missouri on the Day of its Dedication
Scopenote: Slightly blurry image from after the dedication ceremonies for the Harry S. Truman statue in Independence, Missouri. The statue stands in front of the Jackson County Truman Courthouse in Independence Square. Donated by George Viegelmann. Scanned from original negative.

title: Statue of Harry S. Truman in Independence, Missouri on the Day of its Dedication
Scopenote: Slightly blurry image from after the dedication ceremonies for the Harry S. Truman statue in Independence, Missouri. Oblique view of the statue standing in front of the Jackson County Truman Courthouse in Independence Square. Donated by George Viegelmann. Scanned from original negative.

title: View of Jackson County Truman Courthouse in Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: View of the historic Jackson County Truman Courthouse in Independence, Missouri. This view of Independence Square shows a fountain and '76 banners hanging from the light posts. Donated by George Viegelmann. Scanned from original negative.

title: Senator Hubert Humphrey Greets Visitors Outside the Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: Senator Hubert H. Humphrey greets visitors outside the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri. Humphrey was visiting to take part in the Truman statue dedication ceremonies. The other man, a military veteran, is unidentified.

title: President Truman Speaking at a Whistlestop in Illinois During Presidential Campaign
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaking into microphones from the back of a train during his whistlestop campaign in Decatur, Illinois. His talk is being broadcast over Decatur radio station WSOY.

title: President Truman visits U.S. Naval Academy
Scopenote: President Truman visiting the US Naval Academy for a Navy - Penn football game. Pictured in the front row is (from left to right): President Harry S Truman; Superintendent of the Naval Academy, Vice Admiral Aubrey W. Fitch; Brigadier General Harry Vaughan; Secretary of the Navy James Forrestal; Rear Admiral Stuart H. Ingersoll; Admiral of the Fleet William D. Leahy; Press Secretary Charles Ross. Official U.S. Naval Photograph number 2671. Donated by Mr. J. E. Bradshaw.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman with visitors to the Truman Library
Scopenote: (L to R) Paul Cropper, Dennis Cropper, former president Harry S. Truman (wearing a hat and holding his briefcase), Marge Cropper, and Pearl Morrison outside of the north entrance of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, MO. The photograph was taken by a security guard at the library.
